## Summary

Historical examples of harmful research, guidelines for ethical research, reproducible practices.

## References

### Assigned reading

- At least two from the following ethical guidelines created by professional societies:
  - [Royal Statistical Society](https://rss.org.uk/RSS/media/News-and-publications/Publications/Reports%20and%20guides/A-Guide-for-Ethical-Data-Science-Final-Oct-2019.pdf)
  - [American Statistical Association](https://www.amstat.org/your-career/ethical-guidelines-for-statistical-practice)
  - [Association for Computing Machinery](https://www.acm.org/code-of-ethics)

Wikipedia pages to briefly skim:

- [Tuskegee Syphilis Study](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuskegee_Syphilis_Study) (read summary section at the top)
- [Belmont Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belmont_Report) (read History section)
- [Menlo Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menlo_Report) (read Implementation of the Principles section)
